conclusion: Analyze the image of the P-V diagram for the Stirling cycle, focusing on the transition from state A to state B.
The image depicts a P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle with a curve from A to B labeled as an isothermal process.
The Stirling cycle involves four processes: two isothermal and two isochoric.
The process from A to B is isothermal, meaning the temperature remains constant and ΔU is zero.
For an isothermal process, ΔH = PΔV. The sign of ΔH depends on whether PΔV is positive or negative.
In an isothermal compression from A to B, PΔV is negative, indicating heat is released.
The gas releases heat when moving from state A to state B.
